channel.title: Dreams
channel.description: Well it has been on my mind for a while, so i decided to post about it. Dreams are what happens when your subconscious takes over, while you are typically sleeping. Sometimes you will remember them, sometimes you won't. Usually you will not notice it is even a dream, it can feel real some times. However, if you can free your mind of a dream's typical boundaries, find proof of the dream being a dream while still in it, the dream becomes lucid. A lucid dream is when you are still in the dream, but you have absolute full awareness of it. At this point, your mind can take over and can set your imagination free. Sometimes you may think a dream was lucid, but many times it may not have been. I personally have never had one to such an extent that I could control each aspect of it. Actually, I don't think I've ever even had a lucid dream. However, I do believe there are ways to cause a dream to become lucid. I do not know every way, but I've been trying one today (counting peoples' fingers and reading text on objects and around my house twice) and I'm hoping to have one tonight. :) The method I'm trying would have me realize in my dream that the text on the object or something about the fingers (I lol every time at that thought XD) have changed, allowing me to realize that I am in a dream. Also, thinking or saying out loud several times during the day, "I will remember my dreams", will actually help you remember your dreams that night. I tried it last night and had remembered most details about my dream (it was a good one too, so yay). I'm honestly going to try to experiment every night if I can change what I will dream based on thoughts I have before sleeping. Well anyways, that's about all I got to say about this. But before posting, I will add something my friend said today. My friend said today that most dreams are like a movie. You've played the part at some point, and now all you can do is watch. Well I suppose you guys should discuss about this. Dreams interest me very much, and I might study them now that I am learning lucid dream induction methods.

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Yea I know what you mean now that I think of it, several dreams of mine have been lucid, however, I never had mug control over them
And for some reason, I haven’t remembered any dreams after posting this topic o_o’

Read full topic

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

I had one about 2 days ago. I love them so much. The HD vision is probably my favorite part. Like being able to see everything like everywhere, behind, front and sides at one time if you know what I mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:23, topic:298364”][quote author=reverce link=topic=394764.msg2936074#msg2936074 date=1251568122]

This is really interesting. Jme how do you know so much about it?

I’ve been interested in it for a number of years. I got to the point that I was having lucid dreams every couple of days. And I could purposley induce them sometimes. I was even getting some good dream control. But it’s very hard to not wake up once you realize it’s a dream.

I stopped doing it a long time ago now, because my sleeping habits changed (mostly because I smoke too much pot) and it’s too difficult for me now. I stopped keeping a dream journal and lost my ability to remember several dreams every night. But I still try like every morning to go into a lucid dream. I set my alarm clock for 4-6 hours into my sleep. I try to induce sleep paralysis every morning this way because I enjoy the hallucinations and physical sensations.

So your telling if i do what u said , u could like have sex in your dream with somone, i mean if u know its a dream u can like spawn the girl u always liked for you? or the dream keeps going u know its a dream but u cant control it?
[/quote]

That is completely possible yes. The term lucid dreaming just means you are aware it’s a dream. But dream control comes with practice and is 100% possible. Head to dreamviews.com if you want to get serious about it. It takes some committment.

You can read this http://dreamviews.com/dreamcontrol.php but don’t expect to be an expert on the subject just from reading it. But it should give you some more insight.[/quote]
thanks, i

Read full topic

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:11, topic:298364”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=394764.msg2934328#msg2934328 date=1251475580]
Lucid dreams aren’t nice, My brother had one i spent all night sitting with him trying reassure him it was all a dream, I also had Work @ 7AM the next day.
[/quote]

That’s not a lucid dream if you had to reassure him it was a dream. Sounds to me like he had a nightmare.

Lucid dreaming is being fully aware that you are in a dream. For instance you may see flying pigs and realize this is impossible and then you realize you are dreaming. With practice you can control aspects of your dream.

What you should do, is do a reality check everytime you see something abnormal in real life. Even if you think something is odd for the slightest reason or even for a second. Pinch yourself, use a lightswitch, look at the clock, see if you can poke your finger through your palm, whatever. Truly and seriously ask yourself “am I dreaming?” If you can program yourself to get into this habit, you will eventually start doing it in your dreams too.

This is nothing though if you can’t remember your dreams. You might have lucid dreams all the time and not be able to remember them! You should keep a dream journal, and the second you wake up after a dream write down every single detail. The more detail the better. After a while you can remember up to 5 dreams a night.[/quote]
There is proof when u remeber dreams u wil die faster lol
Becous that maens ur brain is overworking trying to put evrything where its supose to be all the 100 000 eyewenks I learn this on school.
When u have a lucid Ur only sleeping for 50% so ur brain needs to “overwork” becous norml ur brain put all those eywenks where they supose to be if u understand what i mean. Its like a television when u buy it i has a “lifetime” of by exemple 5year , same with ur brain .
When u not dream u die. It happend before peeps with sleep problems yust died. nvm to poor english etc. jme u are an pro dreamer

Read full topic

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Typically dreams occur while you are sleeping while you are going through REM (Rapid Eye Movement). When they are lucid are when you realize that are are dreaming, and possibly have the ability to change aspects of the dream. Hallucinations are typically while you are awake, but seeing things that you shouldn’t be, or your vision being somehow distorted.

Read full topic

item.title: Dreams
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Jamie1200:

Lucid dreams aren’t nice, My brother had one i spent all night sitting with him trying reassure him it was all a dream, I also had Work @ 7AM the next day.

That’s not a lucid dream if you had to reassure him it was a dream. Sounds to me like he had a nightmare.

Lucid dreaming is being fully aware that you are in a dream. For instance you may see flying pigs and realize this is impossible and then you realize you are dreaming. With practice you can control aspects of your dream.

What you should do, is do a reality check everytime you see something abnormal in real life. Even if you think something is odd for the slightest reason or even for a second. Pinch yourself, use a lightswitch, look at the clock, see if you can poke your finger through your palm, whatever. Truly and seriously ask yourself “am I dreaming?” If you can program yourself to get into this habit, you will eventually start doing it in your dreams too.

This is nothing though if you can’t remember your dreams. You might have lucid dreams all the time and not be able to remember them! You should keep a dream journal, and the second you wake up after a dream write down every single detail. The more detail the better. After a while you can remember up to 5 dreams a night.

Read full topic

They have an amazing community, and detailed guides on every lucid dreaming induction technique. I am also happy to answer questions I am quite knowledgeable in this subject.

Be sure to read http://dreamviews.com/community/showthread.php?t=66857
